title: What is a social media savvy? - Quora

response.answer_text: A social media savvy is a simply a person who has practical knowledge, and stimulates ideas for potential uses of social media. A social media savvy is some how just like a social media expert which has good quality information about how to perform on social media accounts. Wondering on how to become a social media savvy? Here are the best tips on becoming one: Be regular: you need to post several times a day every day if you’re to be effective.Limit your time: use social media scheduling and tools such as ‘click to tweet’ and social media share buttons.Think visual: social media is increasingly visual so think about how you can best use images to convey your message.Prepare in batches: write, design, find and compile your social media assets ahead of time, in batches.Be prepared: approach social media as you would public relations and be prepared for crises.Set restrictions: engage tools such as ‘SelfControl’ app to limit your access if you find yourself losing time scrolling through social media.Be yourself: you can’t stand out by doing what everyone else is doing. Embrace your quirks, views, passions and interests and share what you’re like, not what you’d like to be like.Share first: give more than you take, share others’ information and promotions, offer your opinion freely and be generous.Remember the three pillars: be useful, valuable and relevant to your ideal clients only.

I can confidently say most of the millennials (Gen X, people born after 1970 and Gen Y, people born after 1980) are social media friendly, but Generation Z (people born after 1990) may be called social media savvy. These people have accounts on virtually all social media sites. their fingers run on the mobile like a robotic instrument. These people will meet an old friend at 4:30PM on a street, at 4:30:30 they will take a selfie together and by 4:31PM, the selfie will be flashing on Instagram, Facebook, Snapchat, Whatsapp and local messengers. They are the people, who stay late night and keep on chatting with their friends on social media. In metro trains and during breaks, you’ll find them disconnected from the rest of the world and glued to their mobile phone screens.
